sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The necessarie, fit, and conuenient education of a yong gentlewoman written both in French and Italian, and translated into English by W. P. And now printed with the three languages togither in one volume, for the better instruction of such as are desirous to studie those tongues. Institutione di una fanciulla nata nobilmente. Polyglot Bruto, Giovanni Michele, ca. 1515-1594. Phiston, William, attributed name.
[160] p.
Printed by Adam Islip, London : 1598.
Italian text, with a French translation, and an English translation by W.P., of: Giovanni Michele Bruto, La institutione di una fanciulla nata nobilmente. W.P. = William Phiston?--Halkett & Laing (3rd ed.). Formerly STC 7499. Identified as STC 7499 on UMI microfilm reel 219. Signatures: A-K. Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library. Appears at UMI microfilm reels 179 and 219 (Bodleian Library copy).
=======
The necessarie, fit, and conuenient education of a yong gentlewoman written both in French and Italian, and translated into English by W. P. And now printed with the three languages togither in one volume, for the better instruction of such as are desirous to studie those tongues. Institutione di una fanciulla nata nobilmente. Polyglot Bruto, Giovanni Michele, ca. 1515-1594. Phiston, William, attributed name.
[160] p.
Printed by Adam Islip, London : 1598.
Italian text, with a French translation, and an English translation by W.P., of: Giovanni Michele Bruto, La institutione di una fanciulla nata nobilmente. W.P. = William Phiston?--Halkett & Laing (3rd ed.). Formerly STC 7499. Identified as STC 7499 on UMI microfilm reel 219. Signatures: A-K. Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
